data_findings.finding: Best achieved score is ~70.62, target is 68.894234 (gap of ~1.73 points = 2.5%). 38+ experiments tried bbox3, SA, GA, MIP, tessellation, basin hopping, deletion cascade, asymmetric solutions, ensemble from 107 sources - ALL converged to same local optimum. Need ~1.23% reduction in ALL side lengths uniformly to reach target.

Key optimization tools: 1) bbox3 C++ optimizer with -n (iterations) and -r (restarts), 2) fix_direction for rotation optimization, 3) Simulated Annealing with fractional translation (0.001, 0.0005, 0.0001 steps), 4) Squeeze/compaction toward centroid. CRITICAL: Local overlap detection is LESS strict than Kaggle's - use buffer=0.001 to avoid LB failures.

Score formula: score = Σ(S²/n) for n=1 to 200. Score breakdown: N=1-10: 4.33 (6.1%), N=11-50: 14.70 (20.8%), N=51-100: 17.61 (24.9%), N=101-150: 17.14 (24.3%), N=151-200: 16.84 (23.8%). N=1 is already at theoretical minimum (0.813 side at 45°). Small N has disproportionate impact.
